items.title: New GlassWorm malware wave targets Macs with trojanized crypto wallets

objects.name: GlassWorm
objects.description: A campaign targeting macOS developers using malicious VSCode/OpenVSX extensions to deliver trojanized crypto wallet applications.
evidence: A fourth wave of the "GlassWorm" campaign is targeting macOS developers
Koi Security researchers discovered a new GlassWorm campaign that targets macOS systems exclusively

objects.name: GlassWorm
objects.description: macOS malware executed via AppleScript and persisted via LaunchAgents. It targets credentials, browser data, and attempts to replace hardware wallet apps with trojanized versions.
evidence: most recent GlassWorm attacks use an AES-256-CBCâ€“encrypted payload embedded in compiled JavaScript
GlassWorm now also attempts to steal Keychain passwords

objects.name: Koi Security
objects.description: Security research organization that discovered the fourth wave of the GlassWorm campaign.
evidence: Koi Security researchers discovered a new GlassWorm campaign

objects.name: Solana blockchain
objects.description: Used as the Command and Control (C2) mechanism for the malware.
evidence: The Solana blockchain-based command-and-control (C2) mechanism remains unchanged.

objects.name: Supply Chain Compromise
evidence: targeting macOS developers with malicious VSCode/OpenVSX extensions

objects.name: Trojanized Applications
objects.description: Replacement of legitimate hardware wallet applications with malicious versions.
evidence: replaces them with a trojanized version
checks for hardware cryptocurrency wallet apps like Ledger Live and Trezor Suite

objects.name: Ledger Live
objects.description: Hardware cryptocurrency wallet application targeted by the malware.
evidence: checks for hardware cryptocurrency wallet apps like Ledger Live

objects.name: Trezor Suite
objects.description: Hardware cryptocurrency wallet application targeted by the malware.
evidence: and Trezor Suite on the host

objects.name: AppleScript
objects.description: Scripting language used by the malware for execution.
evidence: Instead of PowerShell, it now uses AppleScript
A fourth wave of the "GlassWorm" campaign... deliver trojanized versions
The Solana blockchain-based command-and-control (C2) mechanism remains unchanged.
checks for hardware cryptocurrency wallet apps like Ledger Live... and replaces them
checks for hardware cryptocurrency wallet apps like... Trezor Suite on the host
Instead of PowerShell, it now uses AppleScript
targeting macOS developers with malicious VSCode/OpenVSX extensions

items.notes: No specific IOCs (hashes, domains, specific extension names) were provided in the text, though the article mentions 'over 50 browser crypto extensions' were involved.

items.title: NYC mayoral inauguration bans Flipper Zero, Raspberry Pi devices
items.notes: The input text describes physical security policies (banned items list for an event) rather than a specific cyber threat, active campaign, or technical analysis of an attack.
